description: Smallest number that always takes at least n steps to reach 0 under "k -> any product of 2 numbers whose concatenation is k".
comments: Next term is at least 3*10^7. 666 may be the last term. - _Naohiro Nomoto_, Apr 07 2001Checked up to 1.55*10^10. No other numbers apart 666 with minimal path of length 6. The largest number found with minimal path equal to 5 is 711111. - _Giovanni Resta_, Oct 03 2012
author: _Erich Friedman_
